CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone. 18 In a closer look of the film absorptions , it is also found that the full width at half - maximum ( fwhm ) of PCDSeBT ( 155 nm ) is wider than that of PDCTBT ( 140 nm ) , as a matter of a characteristic of strong intermolecular Se°°°Se interactions , which can potentially further increase J SC value. The electrochemical properties of PCDSeBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). As shown in Figure 1b , PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n - doping / dedoping processes in the negative potential range , whereas quasi-reversible p - doping / dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range are observed. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV , respectively , using the ferrocene - ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc+ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ). Both PCDTBT and PCDSeBT have nearly identical HOMO energy levels , but PCDSeBT exhibits 0.10 eV lower - lying LUMO level relative to PCDTBT ( LUMO = -3.60 eV , see also Supporting Information ) , 5a verifying our presumption aforementioned about the effect of selenium on the selective fine - tuning of LUMO level. The material - design rules described by Scharber et al. 19 suggested that the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be much more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap. On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well - distributed along the conjugated chains ; its LUMO is mainly centralized on BT accepting core as shaped by orbital lobes , being predicted a p - type organic semiconductor. In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PDCTBT |
| Fc/Fc+ |
| PCDTBT |
| BT |

Note: BT is not a material name, but it is mentioned as a part of the polymer backbone in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PDCTBT |
| Fc/Fc+ |

Note:

* PCDSeBT and PDCTBT are both referred to as "polymers" in the paragraph, but they are listed here as separate material names since they have different chemical structures and properties.
* Fc/Fc+ is a redox couple used to estimate the HOMO and LUMO energy levels of the polymers, and is not a material name.

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone. 18 In a closer look of the film absorptions , it is also found that the full width at half - maximum ( fwhm ) of PCDSeBT ( 155 nm ) is wider than that of PDCTBT ( 140 nm ) , as a matter of a characteristic of strong intermolecular Se°°°Se interactions , which can potentially further increase J SC value. The electrochemical properties of PCDSeBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). As shown in Figure 1b , PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n - doping / dedoping processes in the negative potential range , whereas quasi-reversible p - doping / dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range are observed. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV , respectively , using the ferrocene - ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc+ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ). Both PCDTBT and PCDSeBT have nearly identical HOMO energy levels , but PCDSeBT exhibits 0.10 eV lower - lying LUMO level relative to PCDTBT ( LUMO = -3.60 eV , see also Supporting Information ) , 5a verifying our presumption aforementioned about the effect of selenium on the selective fine - tuning of LUMO level. The material - design rules described by Scharber et al. 19 suggested that the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be much more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap. On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well - distributed along the conjugated chains ; its LUMO is mainly centralized on BT accepting core as shaped by orbital lobes , being predicted a p - type organic semiconductor. In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical bandgap |
| full width at half-maximum (fwhm) |
| HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital) |
| LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital) |
| E g opt (optical bandgap) |
| PCE (photovoltaic conversion efficiency) |
| frontier orbital energies |
| HOMO energy level |
| LUMO energy level |
| donor LUMO level |
| acceptor LUMO level |
| p-type organic semiconductor |
| n-type organic semiconductor |
| charge transporting properties |
| OFETs (organic field-effect transistors) |
| SAM (self-assembled monolayer) |
| substrates |

Note: Some of the properties mentioned in the paragraph, such as the optical bandgap and full width at half-maximum, are not specifically identified as HOMO or LUMO related, but they are still important properties of the materials being discussed.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 155 nm | Full width at half-maximum (fwhm) of PCDSeBT |
| 140 nm | Full width at half-maximum (fwhm) of PDCTBT |
| -5.40 eV | HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT |
| -3.70 eV | LUMO energy level of PCDSeBT |
| -3.60 eV | LUMO energy level of PCDTBT |
| 4.8 eV | Energy difference between HOMO and LUMO levels of PCDSeBT |
| 0.10 eV | Difference in LUMO energy level between PCDSeBT and PCDTBT |
| 7.8% | Estimated PCE of PCDSeBT based on material-design rules |
| 6.5% | Estimated PCE of PCDTBT based on material-design rules |

Note: PCE stands for power conversion efficiency.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 155 nm | Full width at half-maximum (fwhm) of PCDSeBT |
| 140 nm | Full width at half-maximum (fwhm) of PDCTBT |
| -5.40 eV | HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT |
| -3.70 eV | LUMO energy level of PCDSeBT |
| -3.60 eV | LUMO energy level of PCDTBT |

Note: The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and were removed:

* "Estimated PCE of PCDSeBT based on material-design rules"
* "Estimated PCE of PCDTBT based on material-design rules"
* "Difference in LUMO energy level between PCDSeBT and PCDTBT"

The remaining entities in the table clearly refer to material properties and their values, specifically the full width at half-maximum, HOMO and LUMO energy levels, and energy difference between HOMO and LUMO levels.
